ticTacToe

Class PolicyIterationAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTacToe.Agent
      • ticTacToe.PolicyIterationAgent

  • public class PolicyIterationAgent
extends Agent
    A policy iteration agent. You should implement the following methods: (1) evaluatePolicy(double): this is the policy evaluation step from your lectures (2) improvePolicy(): this is the policy improvement step from your lectures (3) train(): this is a method that should runs/alternate (1) and (2) until convergence.
    Author:
    ae187

      Constructors

      PolicyIterationAgent()
      loads the policy from file if one exists.

      PolicyIterationAgent(double discountFactor, double winningReward, double losingReward, double livingReward, double drawReward)
      Use this constructor to set the various parameters of the Tic-Tac-Toe MDP
      PolicyIterationAgent(Policy p)
      Use this constructor to initialise your agent with an existing policy

    • Method Detail

      • initValues

        public void initValues()
        Initialises the policyValues map, and sets the initial value of all states to 0 (V0 under some policy pi (curPolicy from the lectures). Uses Game.inverseHash(int) and Game.generateAllValidGames(char) to do this.

      • initRandomPolicy

        public void initRandomPolicy()
        You should implement this method to generate a random policy, i.e. fill curPolicy. Take care that the moves you choose for each state ARE VALID. You can use the Game.getPossibleMoves() method to get a list of valid moves and choose randomly between them.

      • train

        public void train()
        This method should perform policy evaluation and policy improvement steps until convergence (i.e. until the policy no longer changes), and so uses what your evaluatePolicy(double) and improvePolicy() methods.
